main_application_settings: This is where the application settings are found.
logs_application_settings: This app writes logs file, and rotates them itself. Use the settings below to control that behavior. Settings save automatically when changed.
advanced_application_settings: These settings control advanced aspects of this application, and should probably not be changed.
LanguageHelpText: While this application supports many languages, there are not many translations available. If you can translate text, please help us out at Notifiarr Translations.
incompletePage: This tool or page is incomplete.

customconfig.Makeabashscript: Make a bash alias or script to do this for you.
customconfig.linuxHelp: {title} will look for {name}.conf in the same folder as the {name} binary. If it is not found, then a location inside your home folder is used for the config file. If you want the config file to live next to the binary: copy it there, restart this app, and it will be used. To use a custom config file path on Linux, provide it as a cli argument when you launch the executable.
customconfig.macHelp: {title} will look for {name}.conf in the same folder as {title}.app. If it is not found, then a location inside your home folder is used for the config file. If you want the config file to live next to the app: copy it there, restart this app, and it will be used. It's difficult to use a custom config location on a mac and is not recommended.
customconfig.winHelp: {title} will look for {name}.conf in the same folder as {title}.exe. If it is not found, then a location inside your home folder is used for the config file. If you want the config file to live next to the exe file: copy it there, restart this app, and it will be used. If you want a custom config file location, follow the instructions below.
customconfig.winCustom: To use a custom config file on Windows, you must create and edit a shortcut. When you use the installer a shortcut is placed in your start menu, and optionally on your desktop. You may use either of these files, or create a new one. Click the Create Shortcut button below to create a new shortcut on your desktop now.
customconfig.winDirectionList:
• Right-click the short cut and click Properties.
  • Click the Shortcut tab if not already there.
  • In Target, ADD this:
  • -c "C:\path\to\{name}.conf"
  • Replace the provided path with your own.

configtooltip.Files: How many backup files to keep when rotating
configtooltip.Size: Rotate log file when it reaches this size
configtooltip.DevMode: Enable this when a developer instructs you to do so.
configtooltip.Updates: Production gets updates from GitHub, unstable gets them from unstable.golift.io
configtooltip.File: Can only be changed on application launch

aboutPage.justWaitin: Just waitin' for somethin' to happen.
aboutPage.Useyourpackagemanager: Use your package manager to install the update.
aboutPage.Clickthebuttontouseit: Click the button to download it.
aboutPage.Clickabuttontouseit: Click a button to use it.
aboutPage.toolbarDescription: Toolbarr fixes problems with Starr apps. It comes with a five starr rating from Toys Arr Us.
aboutPage.CreatedbyGoLift: Created by Go Lift for Notifiarr.

instances.instanceConfig: API key is optional if a username and password is provided. Instances without passwords only require a local URL. Providing the optional DB Path enables SQLite3 Database management features.
instances.MigratorDescription: This tool allows you to update the paths for the media in your {starrApp} library. Use this before moving your library from one server to another if the media content paths are changing.
instances.DBToolsSelector: Select a tool and an instance to get started. The database file must not be in use. Either work on a copy, or exit {starrApp} before proceeding.
instances.ToolsSelector: Select an instance and a tool to get started.
instances.NoURLConfigured: The selected {starrApp} instance ({name}) has no URL configured.
instances.NoDatabasePathConfigured: The selected {starrApp} instance ({name}) has no SQLite3 database file path configured.
instances.EnterNewRootFolder: Enter new root folder path. It must end with a slash. All database tables are updated when save is clicked.
instances.EnterNewRecycleBin: Enter new recycle bin path. It must end with a slash.
instances.unsupportedColumn: This column cannot be remediated by this tool at this time.
instances.IndexersDescription: This tool allows bulk editing indexer configurations.
instances.BlockListDescription: This tool allows bulk editing block list configurations.
instances.CustomFiltersDescription: This Prowlarr tool does not work yet.
instances.DownloadClientsDescription: This tool allows bulk editing download client configurations.
instances.ImportListsDescription: This tool allows bulk editing import list configurations.
instances.AppProfilesDescription: This Prowlarr tool does not work yet.
instances.QualityProfilesDescription: This tool allows bulk editing quality profile configurations.
